comment:
- ATTEND HIS CLASS!!! Doesn't grade attendance, but I recommend going. He will elaborate on PowerPoint (+ even give answers to tests that aren't on there) 
- Weekly HW, based on PP of the week, EZ grades
- Extra Credit!!!
- Camera + closed notes tests, please study!
- Overall, stern professor but chill, open 4 questions + participation

Lecture heavy. Weekly homework. Online labs. OFFERS EXTRA CREDIT! This class was super easy, and the professor had personality. He was a really cool guy, and I would absolutely recommend them. Take thorough notes. Keep up with deadlines. If you put in the work, passing shouldn't be a problem for you.

I got an A in his class. If you do the work, you will do well. From an interpersonal perspective, this professor is not worth your time. He's borderline arrogant and when I took him, he lectured political ideas that were inappropriate for classroom settings. If I could do it over again, I would find someone more pleasant for my prerequisites

Professor Zaborowski is stern but in a good way. Attendance was not mandatory but his lectures were awesome with an occasional joke every now and then. You can tell he's passionate about what he does. 

READ THE TEXTBOOK, powerpoints, and come to class and you'll get an easy A. You have to put forth the effort to receive a good grade (obvi).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: He's not bad. Grades are MES assignments (which are on the test), tests, and lab quizzes (which are extremely easy, you can use notes on them). If you go through the ppts he posts and study them, you'll be fine for the test. Lectures are kind of boring though but sometimes he'll say whats going to be on the test so

Likeable and easy professor who definitely cares about the content he teaches. The tests were all multiple choice, the labs/lab quizzes were easy, and he gave us chances to make up grades that we missed. Would recommend!

He was not a bad professor at all. He was very generous and gave multiple extra credit assignments. Labs are super easy along with the quizzes. The exams are easy if you study. Super easy class but the lectures are so boring.

Solid professor, homework is very easy and there is plenty of easy extra credit offered through the semester that can boost your grade almost a full letter grade. Tests can be difficult, but if you study you will be fine.

To do good you actually need to go over the material. It's really not a hard class if you study a little, he gives 25 points of extra credit throughout the year, and labs are just online quizzes which are easy. His tests aren't bad if you review the PowerPoints and go over his study guides. Labs have a lockdown but no webcam, tests have both.

I didn't show up to class much, but he seemed really nice. He gave us 2 opportunities to make up all missed work. The study guides were useful and outlined the concepts we needed to understand , rather than just saying "read chapters 1-3". Everyone complaining about the study guides must've expected the test questions to just be handed to them.

Very condescending, overall just not a very friendly guy. Attendance is optional because he reads off of powerpoints that are already uploaded online you can copy at your leisure. Tests are on a lockdown browser with a webcam mandatory. Vague/unhelpful study guides. Did offer some extra credit but overall wouldn't recommend. 4/10 is generous
Very nice man, lectures are important. All information on tests can,t always be found in the textbook. Very textbook heavy and the textbook is required. DOES NOT ROUND UP
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Hes boring, honestly find a good study group and you shouldnt have to come to class

I only took this professor because I thought he had decent ratings but I obviously didn't know what was coming. First of all, homework is very easy, so don't worry about that. Labs are ok. Tests are where you are going to have some issues with since he provides veryy vague study guides. So, make sure to study, and read the book. Gives extra credit!

Weekly homework was easy. Tests are on lockdown browser with camera + audio so you really have to know the material, which is difficult because the lectures are long and boring. Quizzes are also on a lockdown browser with no camera and he does allow quiz retakes, BUT he doesn't show what questions you missed on the quiz which defeats the purpose.

Dale is a very nice guy and has a good personality but gives really boring lectures. The good news is that attendance is optional and all the class related assignments are all online. As long as you read through powerpoints and study your notes then the class is relatively easy. Do all the extra credit! The final replaces lowest test grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: I enjoyed SCI 1101 and found Professor Zaborowski engaging, knowledgeable and for those putting in the effort, caring. Attend the lectures and READ/STUDY assigned chapters.  Exams require higher order thinking skills--consider this a bonus given how much you will need to call upon that skill in more advanced classes.   Lockdown Browser no issue

he's okay. his hw is super easy but he uses lockdown browser for each exam. his lab quizzes are hard if you don't read over the background info on each lab, which is what they're mainly based on. he does provide a lot of extra credit opportunities though. overall, his class requires a little more effort for exams but is overall average

I would not recommend Professor again. The test and labs are hard. The labs are really long and had to do them outside of class. The study guide didn't have all the info that was on the test. Most of the info on the test came from the textbook that you also had to read outside of class. I wouldn't take this professor unless you have no other option

There is zero credit for anything a minute late, no exceptions, or for "sob stories". The tests are extremely specific, so have fun studying 102 slides for each chapter to study for an exam that covers multiple chapters.
He is simply rude, and has very tough tests.

This Professor i is funny but I would never want him as a professor again. I can say 1 good thing about him and that is he extra credit that's all. He has 0 pitty for anyone. His tests are very difficult, he has a lot of homework. Just be prepared for his very long and boring lectures and hard test
This Professor i is funny but I would never want him as a professor again. I can say 1 good thing about him and that is he extra credit that's all.
The tests are tough and take up a lot of your grade average. He is willing to help if you are struggling. He gives extra credit, and the extra credit is easy. The labs are hard as well.

I like Dale as a person but his class was kind of boring- but I cannot complain because it was not very hard. Just do your work and youll make an A. Reading the textbook right before a test really helps. I recommend!
Very lecture heavy. Most of the content is high school level, with more advanced additions/concepts. Tests are very ambiguous. Use higher order thinking and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Whatever you do, take him. Professor Zaborowski is a great professor and is willing to help his students out. He is test heavy but, gives plenty of extra credit opportunities. Be ready to read from the textbook and attend class. Those two are the major tips to do well in this class. Lab quizzes are really easy and for hw, use socratic
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Love dale i never went to the online classes just studied a little bit every time there was a test and managed to average a B on all the tests, 40 points of extra credit that is very easy to do and the lab quizzes are easy also, honestly take this guy if you hate science final was decent but definitely a solid choice for a professor

The first test is definitely everyone's worst. His study guides alone are not really that helpful. You should listen to the lecture recordings and also complete the study guide. He stresses reading the textbook but I didn't really do it and I was fine. He offers LOTS of extra credit so take advantage of it!

SCI1101: He gives lectures based on ppts posted, but it is still a good choice to attend these. During lectures he leaves plenty of time for questions, and he also sets time to go over due dates. Tests are decently easy if you read the assigned chapters. He gives TONS of extra credit as well. Learned a lot in this class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He may seem like a tough nut, but deep down he's a good guy who truly loves this subject. And, he offers a good amount of extra credit and chance to ask questions. The textbook and MES is required and are pricey but cheaper than other science classes. Definitely take good notes: Quizlet can help you study a lot. The labs are straightfoward.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hes really good for Environmental Science, and it was pretty easy. He gives good lecture, 4 exams total, and a homework assignment every other week. He also gives a lot of extra credit. He really does care about the students he teaches, and acts like a genuine human.

Professor Zaborowski really cares about the class he's teaching and it's nice to see. You don't have to watch the lectures, but it's a good idea to watch them because the tests are pretty hard sometimes. You have to do a LOT of textbook reading and studying. He gives a few opportunities for extra credit and wants the best for his students.

Attendance not mandatory, but you will miss out on a bunch of bonus points. He lectures the whole time which is boring as h*** but whatever its an easy A. Pro tip: use socratic on the homework he assigns.

Clear grading criteria. Graded for attendance but being in class & taking good notes really helps . He gave plenty of chances to improve your grade. There were 3 tests and a final. When the campus shut down due to Covid, He continued with the course but provided Extra credit opportunities and made himself available in case we had questions.

Heavy lectures, takes occasional attendance for a grade. I failed 2 of 4 tests and still finished with a 95% because of hw grades, lab quizzes and a lot of extra credit. He is a great professor and class was interactive which was fun. No he doesn't bump your grade but what professor does? He was great and really cared about his students.

He isn't a professor anymore but in the future he might come back so I am leaving him a rating. He was easy and the labs were online and you didn't have to actually do them. The class was 4 credit hours so getting an A was very important because it counted more than a regular class. You can easily get an A. Highly recommended if he comes back.

very boring but very easy class. I barely went and managed to get an A. Dr Zab is a really knowledgeable guy teaching students basic concepts they generally don't care about so I believe his expertise is wasted on this class.
He's okay I guess. Won't bump you, extra credit is worth like 5% of the grade. Labs are online and easy.

boring lectures. takes occasional attendance for a grade. tests are pretty hard and he doesnt give very good study guides but he gives plenty of extra credit to help you pass. I failed 3 of 4 tests and still finished with a B because of easy hw grades, easy lab quizzes and a lot of extra credit.

Boring lectures that don't matter if you know anything about environmental from high school, never went to class and did his hw (access codes) and labs online. Very generous with the extra credit points for those who needed it. Easy A for anyone needing science cred.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's not a bad teacher he knows the material. The lectures are very boring and hard to pay attention to especially if you sit in the back of the classroom. The tests were VERY hard, I knew all the material from the study guide and notes but I still struggled on the tests because of the confusing wording on most every question.

I took him for Science 1101 but that wasn't an option to put. I dropped the class before the withdraw period ended. He is so monotone and quiet and in a class of 200+ that doesn't help him. He also takes attendance even with the class as big as it is. The two tests I took were nothing like the powerpoints. A plus is, he posts the powerpoints.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great guy who really loves what he does. tests are pretty hard and he does not give very good study guides. you're pretty much only gonna pass if you read the book. he does give a lot of extra credit opportunities and the hw is an easy A to help your grade. Takes occasional attendance for a grade so its best to go to class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dale is a great guy even though his lectures are boring. No attendance and he gives lots of extra credit near the end of the semester. Make sure to do the homework and study the powerpoints and the practice quizzes on MES.

He's a heavy lecturer but very kind and wants to see his students succeed. You will need to study a lot (!!!) to pass his exams, let alone get an A in his class. He offers lots of extra credit opportunities so that is a given. Don't forget to do the homework because those are by far the only easy points in that class!

Dale is a great guy who cares about the environment, however his class can be slightly difficult. On the first test i didn't study that much and didn't read the chapters and made a 68. After that, before the next test, i read the chapters and studied the powerpoint, i made a 101 on the next test. Read the chapters and study powerpoint. i made a 105

each class is lecture based but theres 200+ people in the class so its expected. he can be funny at times and really cares about the environment. A lot of people rarely went to class. you can do well by just studying online quizzes from pearson and reading powerpoints.

Prof Zaborowski gives lots of extra credit and is very clear about what must be done to pass his class. If you only show up for test day you will pass as long as you study. His lectures are helpful if you are struggling, otherwise you'll be fine skipping his class.

Prof. Zab is a really cool guy who is VERY passionate about what he teaches. The class is 150+ so he does pp slides which he posts online. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you show up he gives out extra credit or test questions not on the study outline. His test outlines are vague so you need to study harder to get an A. READ THE TEXT BOOK

He reads everything almost directly from endless power point slides. This class was difficult because his study guides are very vague. You basically have to read the text book in depth because he likes to add test questions that aren't on the lecture slides to see if you're reading everything in the text book. READ the text book to get an A.

SCI 1102 is a lecture class of 150+ people and he treats it like one. Lectures w/ PowerPoints, which he posts online. Buy online code for textbook to submit the single weekly hw assignments, but don't buy the book itself. His pwrpnt notes follow the TB exactly, but you can still read it online. 4 tests including final exam. Study the PowerPoints.

Basically all of the Environmental Science professors do the course the same. The notes are all off of PowerPoint so yes, Dale is heavy on lectures. Showed up like half the time cause PowerPoints are online. He is funny and truly cares about taking care of our planet. Gives a few extra credit opportunities at the end but I didn't even use them

Nice guy who loves what he teaches. Kinda boring and reads right off powerpoints. Posts lectures online and tests are off lectures. Gives a good amount of extra credit throughout the course. Pretty easy A as long as you study for tests.

Super nice guy, very boring class. He gives SO MUCH EXTRA CREDIT. I rarely went to class and made a 98 (and science is my worst subject). Posts all notes to D2L and sticks almost exactly to the PowerPoint in class. Gives an online homework assignment every 1-2 weeks & you can find most answers online. Don't cheat on tests. He will catch you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: DO NOT TAKE!!! -_-
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I DO NOT recommend this man! Not many people showed up to class so he gave extra credit a few times. He's VERY monotone so I'd advise you to sit in the front. Boring. The pwrpts were extremely too long. Homework like every other week. DONT BUY THE BOOK. He only gives a study guide for the final. 4 tests. Only take him if you have self discipline
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Zaborowski is one of the WORST professors I have every had. He does not know how to teach and gives very boring lectures. He is very broad and does not give study guides or hints about what to study. The book is useful for the homework but get it online or use quizlet. I am an A student & struggled to learn and pass the tests.

You can tell that he loves what he teaches. He reads off the PowerPoint slides but he will randomly give extra credit. You can live without the textbook. His tests are hard because you have to go study everything in the chapter and they're long and boring. Labs are included in the tests but they're no mandatory. Homework answers online.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Homework answers can be found online.  Tests are a bit tough, but read the slides and you'll do good.  Gives extra credit randomly.  Will give a bunch of points towards the end of the semester.  He loves what he does.

Super boring lectures, but super easy teacher. Read the power point slides but also go to class because sometimes he gives extra credit to people who show up. Also at the end of the semester he gives a ton of extra credit assignments. The class after tests we go over them and he eliminates questions that everyone got wrong. Seems to love his job.
Does not give clarify what will be on tests. Lectures are long and boring. Test are difficult and homework every week!
Tests are really hard. Homework every week that you can find answers to online.

Awesome lab professor. Gets you in and out and doesn't waste your time. Tough but just grader. Tells you exactly what he expects at the beginning of the semester. Just learn the pig. Doesn't check off on labs, you just have to do the wirte ups. Always answers emails and is generally helpful. Would probably take his lecture.
He is such an amazing lab professor! Starts labs quick and answers any questions clear detail!
